rdfs:label: Language
dc:description: A specific system of communication, with a vocabulary and grammar, which is used by a particular community or in a country.

rdfs:label: Afroasiatic-language
dc:description: A system of communication belonging to the family of languages mainly spoken in West Asia, North Africa, the Horn of Africa and parts of the Sahara and Sahel.

rdfs:label: Arabic
dc:description: An Afroasiatic language spoken mainly in Northern Africa and Western Asia.

rdfs:label: Hebrew
dc:description: An Afroasiatic language mainly spoken in Israel.

rdfs:label: Atlantic-Congo-language
dc:description: A system of communication belonging to the family of languages mainly spoken in South, and parts of Central and West Africa.

rdfs:label: Swahili
dc:description: An atlantic congo language mainly spoken in Tanzania, Kenya and Mozambique.

rdfs:label: Austroasiatic
dc:description: A system of communication belonging to the family of languages mainly spoken in Southeast Asia, South Asia and East Asia.

rdfs:label: Vietnamese
dc:description: An Austroasiatic language mainly spoken in Vietnam.

rdfs:label: Austronesian-language
dc:description: A system of communication belonging to the family of languages mainly spoken in Southeast Asi, Madagascar, the islands of the Pacific Ocean and Taiwan.

rdfs:label: Malay
dc:description: An Austronesian language manily spoken in Brunei, Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore, East Timor and parts of Thailand.

rdfs:label: Dravidian
dc:description: A system of communication belonging to the family of languages mainly spoken in Southern India, Northeast Sri Lanka Southwest Pakistan and some regions of Nepal.

rdfs:label: Tamil
dc:description: A Dravidian Language spoken the Indian state Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and Sri Lanka and Singapore.

rdfs:label: Indo-European-language
dc:description: A system of communication belonging to the family of languages native to the majority of Europe, the Iranian plateau, and the northern Indian subcontinent.

rdfs:label: Baltic-language
dc:description: A system of communication belonging to the family of languages originating in Northeastern Europe.

rdfs:label: Latvian
dc:description: A baltic language spoken mainly in Latvia.

rdfs:label: Lithuanian
dc:description: A baltic language spoken mainly in Lithuania.

rdfs:label: Germanic-language
dc:description: A system of communication belonging to the family of languages originating in Northwestern and Central Europe and Scandinavia, currently spoken mainly in Europe, North America, Oceania and Southern Africa.

rdfs:label: Danish
dc:description: A Germanic language, mainly spoken in Denmark.

rdfs:label: Dutch
dc:description: A Germanic Language which is spoken in parts of Western Europe, South America and the Caribbean islands.

rdfs:label: English
dc:description: A Germanic Language which is spoken in the United Kingdom, parts of North America, and Oceania and is used in parts of Africa, Asia and Oceania as an adminastrative language.

rdfs:label: German
dc:description: A Germanic Language which is mainly spoken in Western and Central Europe.

rdfs:label: Icelandic
dc:description: A Germanic language mainly spoken in Iceland.

rdfs:label: Norwegian
dc:description: A Germanic language mainly spoken in Norway.

rdfs:label: Swedish
dc:description: A Germanic language mainly spoken in Sweden and parts of Finland.

rdfs:label: Romance-language
dc:description: A system of communication belonging to the family of languages directly descending from Vulgar Latin.

rdfs:label: Catalan
dc:description: A Romance language spoken in Andorra, and several autonomous communities in Eastern Spain as well as a department in Southern France.

rdfs:label: French
dc:description: A Romance language spoken in parts of Western Europe, North America and Africa, and is used as an adminatrative or official language in parts of the world.

rdfs:label: Galician
dc:description: A Romance language mainly spoken in Galicia.

rdfs:label: Gallo-Rhaetian-language
dc:description: A group of historically related Romance varieties spoken in Switzerland and Northern Italy.

rdfs:label: Italian
dc:description: A Romance language mainly spoken in Italy and parts of Switzerland.

rdfs:label: Portuguese
dc:description: A Romance language spoken in Portugal and part of South America (Brazil) and is used as administrative language in other parts of the world.

rdfs:label: Romanian
dc:description: A Romance language spoken in Romania and Moldova as well as small communities in Bulgaria, Hungary, Serbia and Ukraine.

rdfs:label: Spanish
dc:description: A Romance language spoken in Spain and large parts of the Americas.

rdfs:label: Slavic-language
dc:description: A system of communication belonging to the family of languages originating in Eastern Europe.

rdfs:label: Bulgarian
dc:description: A Slavic language spoken mainly in Bulgaria.

rdfs:label: Croatian
dc:description: A Slavic language spoken mainly in Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro and parts of Serbia.

rdfs:label: Czech
dc:description: A Slavic language spoken mainly in the Czech Republic.

rdfs:label: Macedonian
dc:description: A Slavic language spoken mainly in North Macedonia.

rdfs:label: Polish
dc:description: A Slavic language spoken mainly in Poland.

rdfs:label: Russian
dc:description: A Slavic language spoken mainly in Europe and used in parts of Eastern Europe, West and Central Asia.

rdfs:label: Slovak
dc:description: A Slavic language spoken mainly in Slovakia.

rdfs:label: Ukrainian
dc:description: A Slavic language spoken mainly in Ukraine.

rdfs:label: Japonic
dc:description: A system of communication belonging to the family of languages mainly spoken in Japan and the Ryukyu Islands.

rdfs:label: Japanese
dc:description: A Japonic language mainly spoken in Japan.

rdfs:label: Koreanic
dc:description: A system of communication belonging to the family of languages mainly spoken in Korea.

rdfs:label: Korean
dc:description: A Koreanic language mainly spoken in Korea.

rdfs:label: Sino-Tibetan-language
dc:description: A system of communication belonging to the family of languages spoken in Asia.

rdfs:label: Burmo-Qiangic-language
dc:description: A system of communication belonging to the family of language mainly spoken in Southwest China and Myanmar.

rdfs:label: Burmese
dc:description: A Burmo Qiangic language mainly spoken in Myanmar.

rdfs:label: Sinitic
dc:description: A system of communication belonging to the family of languages mainly spoken in China.

rdfs:label: Gan-Chinese
dc:description: A Sinitic language mainly spoken in Jiangxi province , and parts of Hunan, Hubei, Anhui, and Fujian.

rdfs:label: Mandarin-Chinese
dc:description: A group of Chinese language dialects that are natively spoken in most of northern and southwestern China.

rdfs:label: Standard-Chinese
dc:description: A modern standard form of Mandarin Chinese which is the official Language of mainland China.

rdfs:label: Wu-Chinese
dc:description: A Sinitic language mainly spoken in Shanghai, Zhejiang Province, and the part of Jiangsu Province south of the Yangtze River.

rdfs:label: Xiang-Chinese
dc:description: A Sinitic language mainly spoken in Hunan province, northern Guangxi and parts of Guizhou, Guangdong, Sichuan, Jiangxi and Hubei provinces.

rdfs:label: Yue-Chinese
dc:description: A group of Sinitic languages mainly spoken Southern China.

rdfs:label: Cantonese
dc:description: A Sinitic Language mainly spoken southeastern China, Hong Kong and Macau.

rdfs:label: Tai-Kadai
dc:description: A system of communication belonging to the family of languages mainly spoken in Southeast Asia, Southern China, and Northeastern India.

rdfs:label: Thai
dc:description: A Tai Kadai language mainly spoken in Central Thailand.

rdfs:label: Turkic
dc:description: A system of communication belonging to the family of languages spoken in parts of Eurasia such as Eastern Europe, Southern Europe, Central Asia, East Asia, North Asia and West Asia.

rdfs:label: Turkish
dc:description: A Turkish language mainly spoken in Turkey and Northern Cyprus.

rdfs:label: Uralic
dc:description: A system of communication belonging to the family of languages mainly spoken in part of Europe and North Asia.

rdfs:label: Estonian
dc:description: An Uralic Language mainly spoken in Estonia.

rdfs:label: Finnish
dc:description: An Uralic language mainly spoken in Finland.

rdfs:label: Hungarian
dc:description: An Uralic Language mainly spoken in Hungary.

rdfs:label: Bigram
dc:description: A pair of two consecutive written units such as letters, syllables, or words.

rdfs:label: Letter-character
dc:description: A character that is the smallest meaningful or functional unit in an alphabetic writing system.

rdfs:label: Logogram
dc:description: A character representing a morpheme, word or phrase, such as those used in shorthand and some writing systems.

rdfs:label: Noncharacter
dc:description: A character which does not hold any meaning or contain any regularity in a writing system.

rdfs:label: Pseudocharacter
dc:description: A logogram-like character that contains components/radicals of existing logograms but which is not a known logogram.

rdfs:label: Grapheme
dc:description: The smallest contrastive or meaningful unit in writing which matches either a phoneme, a syllable or a morpheme.

rdfs:label: Lemma
dc:description: The canonical form, dictionary form, or citation form of a set of word forms.

rdfs:label: Mora
dc:description: A basic timing unit in the phonology of some spoken languages, equal to or shorter than a syllable.

rdfs:label: Morpheme
dc:description: A meaningful unit of a language that cannot be further divided.

rdfs:label: Phone
dc:description: A minimal speech segment that possesses distinct physical or perceptual properties.

rdfs:label: Consonant
dc:description: A basic speech sound which is produced with an obstructed vocal tract and which can be combined with a vowel to form a syllable, or which can form itself or together with another consonant a syllable.

rdfs:label: Vowel
dc:description: A speech sound which is produced with a relatively open vocal tract and vibration of the vocal cords.

rdfs:label: Diphthong
dc:description: A sound formed by the combination of two vowels.

rdfs:label: Long-vowel
dc:description: A vowel sound that is pronounced in a long form.

rdfs:label: Short-vowel
dc:description: A vowel sound that is pronounced in a short form.

rdfs:label: Radical
dc:description: A graphical component of a Chinese character under which the character is traditionally listed in a Chinese dictionary.

rdfs:label: Language-item-property
dc:description: A property of a language item within a framework of language analysis.

rdfs:label: Clause-type
dc:description: The type of a clause.

rdfs:label: Dependent-clause
dc:description: Containing a subject and verb and cannot be a sentence on its own.

rdfs:label: Independent-clause
dc:description: Containing a subject and verb but can be a sentence on its own.

rdfs:label: Grammatical-category
dc:description: Grammatical category of a word, usually marked through inflection.

rdfs:label: Aspect
dc:description: Non-deictic category of verbal morphology that describes the internal temporal contour of an event and presents it for instance as ongoing or completed.

rdfs:label: Imperfective-aspect
dc:description: Presenting an ongoing or unfolding or repeated or habitual event.

rdfs:label: Perfective-aspect
dc:description: Presenting a completed event.

rdfs:label: Case
dc:description: Formal feature of several word classes (e.g., nouns, pronouns, adjectives, determiners) that identifies their syntactic function.

rdfs:label: Ablative
dc:description: Used to express motion away from something, among other uses.

rdfs:label: Accusative
dc:description: Used to indicate the direct object of a transitive verb.

rdfs:label: Dative
dc:description: Used to indicate the recipient or beneficiary of an action.

rdfs:label: Genitive
dc:description: Used to indicate attributive relations between nouns among other uses.

rdfs:label: Nominative
dc:description: Generally marks the subject of a verb, or a predicate nominal or adjective, as opposed to its object, or other verb arguments.

rdfs:label: Countability
dc:description: A grammatical category that determines how the quantity of a concept is expressed.

rdfs:label: Countable
dc:description: Syntactic property of nouns that can be modified by quantities (expressed by grammatical number, e.g. singular, plural).

rdfs:label: Uncountable
dc:description: Syntactic property of nouns that makes their referents undifferentiated units.

rdfs:label: Grammatical-number
dc:description: Formal feature of several word classes (e.g., nouns, pronouns, adjectives, verbs) that expresses or marks count distinctions, such as one vs. two vs. three or more.

rdfs:label: Collective
dc:description: Not representing a specific number.

rdfs:label: Dual
dc:description: Representing exactly two instances of a concept.

rdfs:label: Paucal
dc:description: Representing a few, or small number of instances of a concept.

rdfs:label: Plural
dc:description: Representing multiple instances of a concept.

rdfs:label: Singular
dc:description: Representing one instance of a concept.

rdfs:label: Singulative
dc:description: Representing one instance of a concept through modifying the standard collective.

rdfs:label: Trial
dc:description: Representing exactly three instances of a concept.

rdfs:label: Mood
dc:description: Non-deictic category of verbal morphology that expresses speakers attitudes as regards the possibility, probability/likelihood, desirability, necessity, factuality etc. of the event.

rdfs:label: Conditional
dc:description: Used for speaking of an event whose realization is dependent upon another condition.

rdfs:label: Imperative
dc:description: Expresses direct commands, prohibitions, and requests.

rdfs:label: Progressive
dc:description: Expresses an incomplete state or action.

rdfs:label: Subjunctive
dc:description: Used in dependent clauses to discussing imaginary or hypothetical events and situations, expressing opinions or emotions, or making polite requests, among a broad range of other uses across languages.

rdfs:label: Noun-class
dc:description: Formal category of nouns based on characteristic features of their referents, such as gender, animacy, shape, location or directionality.

rdfs:label: Tense
dc:description: Deictic category of verbal morphology that situates an event (on an imaginary timeline) as either anterior, posterior or simultaneous to a reference point, prototypically time of speech.

rdfs:label: Future-tense
dc:description: Referring to an event posterior to time of speech.

rdfs:label: Future-perfect
dc:description: Referring to a future event relative to another reference point (not the time of speech).

rdfs:label: Near-future-tense
dc:description: Referring to an event shortly after time of speech.

rdfs:label: Remote-future-tense
dc:description: Referring to an event in the remote future.

rdfs:label: Non-future-tense
dc:description: Referring to both a past or present event.

rdfs:label: Non-past-tense
dc:description: Referring to both a present or future event.

rdfs:label: Past-tense
dc:description: Referring to an event anterior to time of speech.

rdfs:label: Pluperfect
dc:description: Referring to a past event relative to another reference point (not the time of speech).

rdfs:label: Recent-past-tense
dc:description: Referring to an event in the recent past.

rdfs:label: Remote-past-tense
dc:description: Referring to an event in the distant past.

rdfs:label: Present-tense
dc:description: Referring to an event that takes place at time of speech.

rdfs:label: Language-item-form
dc:description: The form of a language item.

rdfs:label: Spoken-form
dc:description: The expression of a language item as a sound produced by a human or artificially made to sound as if produced by a human.

rdfs:label: Canonical-spoken-form
dc:description: The regular spoken form of a language item.

rdfs:label: Mispronounced-spoken-form
dc:description: A mispronunciation of a language item which can still be identified.

rdfs:label: Regional-spoken-form
dc:description: A spoken form of a language item pronounced with a regional accent.

rdfs:label: Written-form
dc:description: The expression of a language item through a system of writing.

rdfs:label: Canonical-written-form
dc:description: The accepted spelling of a word in a given language.

rdfs:label: Incorrect-written-form
dc:description: An incorrect written form that does not correspond to the canonical or the pronounced form of a word, but from which the word can still be identified as such.

rdfs:label: Pseudohomophone-form
dc:description: A deliberate generated written-form of a word that is not in accordance with an orthographic system but is pronounced as the word based on direct grapheme to phoneme conversion.

rdfs:label: Language-item-frequency
dc:description: The frequency with which a language item occurs in a language, or a particular context for that language e.g. formal, news articles, children's television, etc.

rdfs:label: Bigram-frequency
dc:description: The frequency with which a bigram occurs in a language, or a particular context for that language e.g. formal, news articles, children's television, etc.

rdfs:label: Word-frequency
dc:description: The frequency with which a word occurs in a language, or a particular context for that language e.g. formal, news articles, children's television, etc.

rdfs:label: Language-item-probability
dc:description: The probability of a specific language item occurring in a specific context.

rdfs:label: Cloze-probability
dc:description: The proportion of people who fill a gap in given sentence with a given word.

rdfs:label: Lexical-role
dc:description: The role a language item takes in a vocabulary, like part of speech.

rdfs:label: Adjective
dc:description: A word that describes or defines a noun or noun phrase.

rdfs:label: Adposition
dc:description: Accompanying an noun to express a spatial or temporal relation.

rdfs:label: Circumposition
dc:description: Appearing before and after a noun or noun phrase expressing spatial or temporal relation to another word or element in the clause.

rdfs:label: Postposition
dc:description: Appearing after a noun or noun phrase expressing a spatial or temporal relation to another word or element in the clause.

rdfs:label: Preposition
dc:description: Preceding a noun or noun phrase expressing a spatial or temporal relation to another word or element in the clause.

rdfs:label: Adverb
dc:description: Modifying or qualifying an adjective, verb, or other adverb or a word group, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc.

rdfs:label: Classifier
dc:description: An item that accompanies nouns and can be considered to classify a noun depending on the type of its referent.

rdfs:label: Conjunction
dc:description: Connecting clauses or sentences or to coordinate words in the same clause.

rdfs:label: Complementizer
dc:description: Marks a finite or non- finite clause as functioning as a complement.

rdfs:label: Coordinating-conjunction
dc:description: Coordinates elements that are equal to each other.

rdfs:label: Negation-word
dc:description: Expressing falsity of a clause or sentence.

rdfs:label: Determiner
dc:description: Determining the kind of reference a noun or noun group has.

rdfs:label: Article
dc:description: A class of dedicated words that are used with noun phrases to mark the identifiability of the referents of the noun phrases.

rdfs:label: Possessive-determiner
dc:description: Determining the ownership of a noun or noun phrase.

rdfs:label: Interjection
dc:description: A word or expression that occurs as an utterance on its own and expresses a spontaneous feeling or reaction.

rdfs:label: Noun
dc:description: Referring to a specific object or set of objects (living creatures, places, actions, qualities, states of existence, ideas etc.

rdfs:label: Numeral
dc:description: Expressing a number or relation to a number.

rdfs:label: Particle
dc:description: Must be associated with another word or phrase to impart meaning.

rdfs:label: Pronoun
dc:description: A word or a group of words that may stand for a noun or noun phrase.

rdfs:label: Demonstrative-pronoun
dc:description: Pronoun used to indicate which entities are being referred to and to distinguish those entities from others.

rdfs:label: Indefinite-pronoun
dc:description: Pronoun lacking a specific referent or having generic meaning.

rdfs:label: Interrogative-pronoun
dc:description: Pronoun which prompts a question.

rdfs:label: Personal-pronoun
dc:description: Pronoun associated with a grammatical person.

rdfs:label: Possessive-pronoun
dc:description: Pronoun referring to the possession of a grammatical person.

rdfs:label: Reflexive-pronoun
dc:description: Pronoun that refers to another noun or pronoun within the same sentence.

rdfs:label: Relative-pronoun
dc:description: Pronoun that marks a relative clause.

rdfs:label: Quantifier
dc:description: Expressing a reference definite or indefinite number or amount.

rdfs:label: Verb
dc:description: Generally conveying an action, occurrence, or state of being and makes up the main part of the predicate of a sentence.
omn:EquivalentTo: Lexical-role and (suggestedTag some Tense) and (suggestedTag some Mood) and (suggestedTag some Aspect)

rdfs:label: Auxiliary-verb
dc:description: A verb devoid of lexical content that combines with another verb to realize certain grammatical functions (e.g. expression of tense, passive voice, negation, interrogation).

rdfs:label: Modal-verb
dc:description: An auxiliary verb that combines with another verb and expresses necessity, wish or possibility.

rdfs:label: Intransitive-verb
dc:description: A verb that does not require an object.

rdfs:label: Psychological-verb
dc:description: A verb that takes two arguments, an experiencer and a theme.

rdfs:label: Transitive-verb
dc:description: A verb that requires one or more objects to receive the action.

rdfs:label: Unaccusative-verb
dc:description: An intransitive verb whose subject is a theme (i.e. affected by the process the verb expresses).

rdfs:label: Unergative-verb
dc:description: An intransitive verb whose subject is an agent.

rdfs:label: Morpheme-property
dc:description: A property of a morpheme.

rdfs:label: Morpheme-function
dc:description: The function of a morpheme.

rdfs:label: Inflective-morphological-function
dc:description: Changing the grammatical function.

rdfs:label: Conjugate
dc:description: Identifying the voice, mood, tense, number, gender, and person of a verb.

rdfs:label: Decline
dc:description: Marking the number, case, gender, or class of nouns, pronouns, adjectives, and articles.

rdfs:label: Word-formation-function
dc:description: Creating a new word.

rdfs:label: Compound
dc:description: To join with another free morpheme to form a more complex word.

rdfs:label: Derivation
dc:description: Changing the meaning of a word, usually by adding an affix.

rdfs:label: Change-word-class
dc:description: Changing the word class or part of speech a word belongs to.

rdfs:label: Morpheme-type
dc:description: The type of a morpheme.

rdfs:label: Bound-morpheme-type
dc:description: A morpheme type that cannot be a word itself, such as prefixes and suffixes.

rdfs:label: Free-morpheme-type
dc:description: A morpheme type that can function as a word.

rdfs:label: Morphological-position
dc:description: The position a morpheme takes relative to the free morpheme of a word.

rdfs:label: Affix
dc:description: A morpheme that is attached to a word stem to form a new word or word form.

rdfs:label: Circumfix
dc:description: Position of a morpheme split in two parts, one placed at the start of a word, the other at the end.

rdfs:label: Infix
dc:description: Position of a morpheme in the middle of a word.

rdfs:label: Non-concatenative-morphology
dc:description: Process of word formation and inflection in which the stem may be modified (without stringing morphemes together sequentially).

rdfs:label: Apophony
dc:description: Regular vowel variation.

rdfs:label: Clitic-morphological-position
dc:description: A morpheme that has syntactic characteristics of a word, but which is phonologically dependent on another word.

rdfs:label: Conversion
dc:description: No change (where a morphological change might be expected based on regular grammar).

rdfs:label: Reduplication
dc:description: Duplication of all or part of the root word.

rdfs:label: Transfixation
dc:description: Interdigitation of vowel and consonant morphemes.

rdfs:label: Truncation
dc:description: Removal of phonological material from root.

rdfs:label: Prefix
dc:description: Position of a morpheme at the beginning of a word.

rdfs:label: Suffix
dc:description: Position of a morpheme at the end of a word.

rdfs:label: Orthographic-neighborhood-size
dc:description: The number of closely resembling word-forms.

rdfs:label: Phrase-role
dc:description: The role of phrase.

rdfs:label: Adjective-phrase
dc:description: Headed by an adjective.

rdfs:label: Adpostional-phrase
dc:description: Consisting of an adposition and its complement.

rdfs:label: Postpositional-phrase
dc:description: Consisting of a postposition and its complement.

rdfs:label: Prepositional-phrase
dc:description: Consisting of a preposition and its complement.

rdfs:label: Adverb-phrase
dc:description: Functioning as an adverb in a sentence.

rdfs:label: Noun-phrase
dc:description: Functioning in a sentence as subject, object, or prepositional object.

rdfs:label: Verb-phrase
dc:description: Containing the verb and any direct or indirect object, but not the subject.

rdfs:label: Syntactic-role
dc:description: Role a language-item takes in syntax.

rdfs:label: Complement
dc:description: The constituent selected by a head.

rdfs:label: Syntactic-object
dc:description: Complement of a verbal head.

rdfs:label: Direct-syntactic-object
dc:description: A constituent which receives the action of the verb or comes into existence by this action.

rdfs:label: Indirect-syntactic-object
dc:description: A constituent representing a secondary or passive participant, often a goal, a beneficiary or an experiencer.

rdfs:label: Modifier
dc:description: Optional element in a phrase or a clause that specifies a noun or acts as an adjunct.

rdfs:label: Adjunct
dc:description: Optional element in a clause or sentence that provides information about the temporal, local (etc.) circumstances under which an event occurred.

rdfs:label: Predicate
dc:description: Basic constituent of a clause that expresses a property or condition of the subject or an action performed by it.

rdfs:label: Secondary-predicate
dc:description: Adjectival or prepositional predicate that is not the main (verbal) predicate of the clause and refers to the subject or the object, as either depictive (indicating a state) or resultative (indicating the event's result on the object).

rdfs:label: Subject
dc:description: Basic constituent of a clause about which something is said; typically, but not necessarily, associated with a specific case (most often nominative).

rdfs:label: Syntactic-Head
dc:description: Word that determines the syntactic category of a phrase.

rdfs:label: Language-property
dc:description: A property relating to a system of communication used by a particular group of people.

rdfs:label: Morphological-language-type
dc:description: Morphological property relating to a specific system of communication used by a particular group of people.

rdfs:label: Analytic-language-type
dc:description: Rarely using affixes, resulting in a low morpheme per word ratio.

rdfs:label: Morphological-isolating-type
dc:description: Having a morpheme per word ratio close to one.

rdfs:label: Morphological-polysynthetic-type
dc:description: Can encode multiple constituents such as subject, verb, object, etc. into a single word.

rdfs:label: Morphological-synthetic-type
dc:description: Having a higher morpheme per word ratio.

rdfs:label: Morphological-agglutinating-type
dc:description: Words are formed by stringing together morphemes whereby each one corresponds to a single grammatical feature.

rdfs:label: Morphological-fusional-type
dc:description: Have a tendency to use a single inflectional morpheme to denote multiple grammatical, syntactic, or semantic features.

rdfs:label: Orthographic-type
dc:description: The type of language item each symbol serves to represent in written language.

rdfs:label: Logographic-type
dc:description: Representing an entire spoken word per character.

rdfs:label: Segmental-or-Alphabetic-type
dc:description: Representing approximately phoneme per character.

rdfs:label: Deep-orthographical-type
dc:description: Not having a one-to-one correspondence between sounds (phonemes) and the letters (graphemes) that represent them.

rdfs:label: Shallow-orthographic-type
dc:description: Having a one-to-one correspondence between sounds (phonemes) and the letters (graphemes) that represent them.

rdfs:label: Syllabary-type
dc:description: Representing one syllable or mora per character.

rdfs:label: Linguistic-relation
dc:description: Related based on a linguistic property to.

rdfs:label: Grammatical-relation
dc:description: Grammatical relationship between language items.

rdfs:label: Agreement-with
dc:description: Inflectional adjustment to match grammatical category (e.g. case, number, gender) of.

rdfs:label: Orthographic-relatedness-to
dc:description: Connected on the basis of writing or spelling.

rdfs:label: Orthographic-distance-to
dc:description: Removed in orthographic or written form (e.g. a measure of how far cat is removed from rat in orthography).

rdfs:label: Hamming-distance-to
dc:description: The minimum number of substitutions required to change one string into another string of equal length.

rdfs:label: Hamming-distance-to-#
dc:description: Integers 0 and up.

rdfs:label: Levenshtein-distance-to
dc:description: The minimum number of single-character edits to change into.

rdfs:label: Levenshtein-distance-to-#
dc:description: Integers 0 and up.
